Legal_Issue: Whether the Appeal Board exceeded its jurisdiction and breached procedural fairness in nullifying the March 5, 2004 election
Application_Facts: The Appeal Board prematurely certified the election results as null without following the required procedure and failed to give adequate notice to all parties before the hearing
Decision_Outcome: The Appeal Board's decisions are set aside
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review application challenging the Appeal Board's decisions
Court_Ruling: The Appeal Board's decisions were annulled, and the case was sent back for re-evaluation
Defendant_Behavior: Prematurely nullifying the election without proper procedure or notice
Grounds_for_Claim: Alleged irregularities in the March 5, 2004 election
Legal_Standard: Two-step process for election appeals: determining sufficiency of evidence and conducting hearing within 14 days with proper notice
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide adequate notice and premature decision-making by the Appeal Board
Legal_Provision_Cited: Pelican Lake Election Act provisions on appeal procedures
Application_Basis: Appeal based on procedural non-compliance and lack of due process
Relief_Sought: Annulment of Appeal Boardâ€™s decision and remittal for redetermination
Governing_Rule: Pelican Lake Election Act mandates a two-step appeal process with proper notice
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Lack of sufficient procedural adherence and inadequate notification
Outcome: Decisions set aside; matter remitted for redetermination
Harm_Assessment: Potential invalidation of election results without fair process
Cause_Description: Dispute over the validity of the March 5, 2004 election due to alleged irregularities
Evidence_Handling: Failure to properly conduct hearing with full party participation
Legal_Provision_Violated: Procedural requirements under the Pelican Lake Election Act
Evidence_Issues: Insufficient procedural fairness and lack of notice
Legal_Provision: Pelican Lake Election Act - two-step appeal process
Jurisdictional_Issue: Whether the Appeal Board exceeded its jurisdiction
Decision_Rationale: The Appeal Board acted outside the mandated procedure and denied procedural fairness
Evidentiary_Issues: Lack of proper notice and premature ruling
Legal_Standard_Applied: Compliance with statutory procedural requirements under the Pelican Lake Election Act
